counterintuitiveDetail: The v4.0 model learned that known corrupt vendors use competitive procedures — they don't need shortcuts because they dominate their markets. The #1 corruption predictor is vendor concentration (18.7x likelihood ratio), not procedure type. This contradicts standard OECD methodology.
